decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a powerful infect creature (such as Blighted Agent or Glistener Elf) and utilize various pump spells (such as Scale Up, Might of Old Krosa, and Distortion Strike) to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. Cards like Noble Hierarch and Vines of Vastwood help protect your infect creatures, while Blossoming Defense and Apostle's Blessing provide additional protection and evasion. Inkmoth Nexus serves as an alternate win condition, allowing you to turn it into a creature and activate its infect ability for a surprise victory.

This deck focuses on establishing Tron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to produce a high amount of mana quickly. It utilizes counterspells (Condescend, Remand) and bounce spells (Repeal) to control the opponent's board, while also using Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opponent's artifacts. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while ramping into powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. Chalice of the Void is used to lock down specific mana costs, creating a difficult board state for the opponent to navigate.

The primary focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing powerful control elements such as Cryptic Command, Kolaghan's Command, and Archmage's Charm, as well as disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Fatal Push, the goal is to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. Additionally, the presence of Snapcaster Mage and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy allows for repeated use of key spells, while Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional late-game value. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's control strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence of powerful Human creatures, using cards like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Meddling Mage, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Kitesail Freebooter and Reflector Mage. The deck also aims to utilize Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and efficiently use mana from lands like Ancient Ziggurat and Cavern of Souls. This aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of aggressive creatures and disrupting their game plan to secure victory.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively burn through the opponent's life total using cheap and efficient red spells and creatures. It aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, with cards like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart allowing for direct damage to the opponent's life total. By maximizing the use of efficient creatures like Kiln Fiend and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of card draw spells like Light Up the Stage and Bedlam Reveler helps maintain card advantage and fuel the aggressive strategy.

Utilizing strong planeswalkers, counterspells, removal, and land ramp, this deck aims to control the game by manipulating the board state and drawing cards. The deck also includes powerful win conditions like Felidar Retreat and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to close out the game. By disrupting the opponent's strategy and building a strong mana base with a variety of dual lands, this deck is designed to outlast and outplay the opponent in a drawn-out control matchup.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand through counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage and tempo. The deck includes a variety of instant-speed cards to respond efficiently to threats, with a focus on keeping the opponent on the back foot. Utilizing powerful blue and white spells, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a victory.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive Merfolk tribal strategy. By utilizing lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost the power and toughness of all Merfolk creatures, along with disruptive cards like Merfolk Trickster and Unsettled Mariner, the deck can quickly establish board control and pressure the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Force of Negation and Path to Exile provide answers to opponent threats, while Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment. Spreading Seas can disrupt opponent's mana base, giving the deck additional advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to cast powerful spells like Ancestral Vision and Restore Balance for free using cards like As Foretold and Electrodominance. By controlling the board with cards like Greater Gargadon and Brazen Borrower, and using the suspended spells to reset the game state, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plans while establishing its own board presence. The balance between casting free spells and maintaining control over the game is crucial for the success of this combo-based deck in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Elvish Reclaimer and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove to cast powerful creatures like Primeval Titan and Omnath, Locus of Creation. The key combo involves getting Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and multiple Mountains onto the battlefield to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. Cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Explore help to draw more cards and find the pieces needed for the combo. The deck also includes removal spells like Path to Exile to control the board and keep the opponent's threats in check.

The deck focuses on aggressively playing powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Scourge of the Skyclaves while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Stubborn Denial. The deck also utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble, Thought Scour, and Traverse the Ulvenwald to efficiently fill the graveyard and enable Death's Shadow to become a massive threat. The deck aims to quickly close out the game by leveraging the power of these threats and disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively swarm the opponent with Spirit creatures, utilizing cards like Drogskol Captain and Supreme Phantom to boost their power and toughness. Cards like Mausoleum Wanderer and Spell Queller provide disruption for the opponent's spells, while Selfless Spirit protects the team from board wipes. Aether Vial allows for creatures to be put into play at instant speed, further increasing the deck's tempo. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and evasive offense while maintaining some level of control.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly swarm the board with small aggressive white creatures, leveraging cards like Aether Vial and Ranger of Eos to put pressure on the opponent. The combination of anthem effects from cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Luminarch Aspirant, along with protection from cards like Giver of Runes and Auriok Champion, allows the deck to go wide and build a strong board presence. The deck also includes disruption elements like Skyclave Apparition and Ranger-Captain of Eos to handle threats from the opponent while maintaining a fast and aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the combo of Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Walking Ballista with the help of cards like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies. The deck focuses on using efficient creatures like Kitchen Finks and Spike Feeder to gain life and establish a board presence. Collected Company and Eladamri's Call are used to tutor for combo pieces, while Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility. The deck aims to win through infinite life gain and damage with Walking Ballista, creating a resilient and versatile strategy in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures like Death's Shadow and Monastery Swiftspear, using various spells and combat tricks to protect and buff them. It also leverages Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to recur key creatures and spells from the graveyard. The deck aims to efficiently deal damage to the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Kolaghan's Command. Overall, the strategy revolves around a fast and powerful aggro game plan with the potential for explosive turns.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance, Blood Moon, and Pillage to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf, while also applying pressure with creatures like Bloodbraid Elf and Elder Gargaroth. Klothys, God of Destiny helps to provide additional value and resilience. Overall, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also presenting a strong board presence to close out the game.
